2. Ribavirin: This is an antiviral medication used to treat hepatitis C and other viral hemorrhagic fevers.
3. Pegylated interferon: This is a form of interferon, a type of protein that is part of the body's natural defense against viruses. It is pegylated, meaning that it has been modified to remain in the body for a longer period of time.
4. Telaprevir: This is a medication used to treat hepatitis C, specifically genotype 1. It is an inhibitor of the NS3/4A protease, an enzyme that the hepatitis C virus needs to replicate.
